thread.title: Chelsea Legend Frank Lampard Has Returned To Stamford Bridge
thread.title_full: Chelsea Legend Frank Lampard Has Returned To Stamford Bridge

title: Chelsea Legend Frank Lampard Has Returned To Stamford Bridge
text:
Chelsea Legend Frank Lampard Has Returned To Stamford Bridge Fri Feb 10 2017 20:38:46   20:38:46 GMT+0000 (GMT) Ryan Sidle Ryan Sidle in football 
Having retired from football earlier in the season it feels like there was only one thing that Frank Lampard could do as his next career move, return to Stamford Bridge. 
It's easy to forget that Chelsea wasn't even Frank Lampard's final Premier League club. He moved to Manchester City before a move across the pond to their sister club New York City Football Club. 
However despite that fact the former West Ham United youth product remains a legend at Stamford Bridge. It's no surprise really considering he's their record top goal scorer. 
And according to reports today Lampard has already returned to Stamford Bridge and more specifically Cobham Training Centre to work with the academy as he works towards his UEFA B licence. 
The 38 year old left New York at the end of the MLS season and had been linked with new clubs, including some in the Premier League, but decided to retire at the beginning of this month. 
Talking about the former midfielder current Chelsea boss Antonio Conte said about his new coaching career, "Frank is a legend for this club and now I think he's starting a new career. 
"Now is the time to take the best decision for him, it's not easy because I passed this moment [when I retired]... 
" But Frank can work in football and can work as a coach. He can do it very well." 
Lampard isn't the only Blues legend working on his coaching badges based on John Terry's recent Instagram post: A photo posted by John Terry (@johnterry.26) on Feb 8, 2017 at 12:38am PST 
With Patrick Vieira and Mikel Arteta deciding against joining Arsenal's backroom staff in favour for positions in the Manchester City group Chelsea will be happy Lampard decided against doing the same. 
Lampard joins Steven Gerrard as recently retired midfielders to have returned to their former clubs and the prospect of them both managing in the future is quite tasty: What if Giggs manages #MUFC , Gerrard at #LFC , Lampard at Chelsea, Henry at Arsenal. Who will manage Manchester City? Richard Dunne. :joy::joy: - Grumpy Mourinho (@GrumpyMourinho) February 4, 2017 Sponsored Links
